snippet: The United Nations Relief and Works Agency pointed to a $55 million budget shortfall and said the cuts were based on a re-evaluation of Gaza’s needs.
abstract: Hundreds of women and children in Gaza protest cutbacks in United Nations food-assistance program, latest in a growing backlash by Palestinian refugees and their offspring in the forlorn coastal strip against the agency that for decades has provided them with nutrition, education and health services.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations Relief and Works Agency pointed to a $55 million budget shortfall and said the cuts were based on a re-evaluation of Gaza’s needs.

headline.main: Cutbacks in U.N. Food Assistance Set Off Outcry in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Cutbacks in U.N. Food Assistance Set Off Outcry in Gaza
